instruction: State the contrapositive of the following claim, moving all negations so they are on individual predicates.
claim: For every dragon d, if d is green, then d is not large or d is fat.
solution: For every dragon d, if d is large and d is not fat, then d is not green.

instruction: State the negation of the following claim, moving all negations so that they are on individual predicates.
claim: For every tiger k, if k is orange, then k is large and k is not friendly.
solution: There exists a tiger k such that k is orange and (k is not large or k is friendly).

instruction: State the contrapositive of the following claim, moving all negations so that they are on individual predicates.
claim: For every tiger k, if k is orange, then k is large and k is not friendly.
solution: For every tiger k, if k is not large or k is friendly, then k is not orange.

instruction: State the negation of the following claim, moving all negations so that they are on individual predicates.
claim: For any student s, if s rides a bicycle, then s wears a helmet or s has no fear of death.
solution: There exists a student s such that s rides a bicycle and s does not wear a helmet and s has a fear of death.

instruction: State the contrapositive of the following claim, moving all negations so that they are on individual predicates.
claim: For any student s, if s rides a bicycle, then s wears a helmet or s has no fear of death.
solution: For any student s, if s does not wear a helmet and s has a fear of death, then s does not ride a bicycle.

instruction: Find all integer solutions to the following equation. Show your work.
solution: Rearrange: $2p^2 + 5p - 3 = 0$. Factor: $(2p - 1)(p + 3) = 0$. So $p = 1/2$ or $p = -3$. Since we need integer solutions, $p = -3$.

instruction: Multiply out and simplify, showing your work.
Solve for x, expressing your answer as a single fraction. Simplify your answer and show your work.
State the negation of the following claim, moving all negations so that they are on individual predicates.
claim: For all cats c, if c is fluffy, then c is not mean or c is playful.
solution: There exists a cat c such that c is fluffy and c is mean and c is not playful.

instruction: State the contrapositive of the following claim, moving all negations so they are on individual predicates.
claim: For every bird b, if b can fly and b is colorful, then b is not a penguin.
solution: For every bird b, if b is a penguin, then b cannot fly or b is not colorful.

instruction: Find all integer solutions to the following equation. Show your work.
solution: Factor: $(x - 2)(x - 3) = 0$. So $x = 2$ or $x = 3$. Both are integers.
